entry.question: Who picks their Weapon to scrap first? Who picks a card in their hand to scrap first?
entry.answer: Any time both players are given the same instruction, the player whose turn it is goes first. If you play Collateral Damage, first you’ll scrap a Weapon from one of your characters, then your opponent will, then you’ll scrap a card from your hand, and finally your opponent will.

entry.question: Can I play Collateral Damage if none of my characters have a Weapon or if I won’t have any other cards in my hand?
entry.answer: Yes. You can always play an Action card, even if you can’t carry out some of its instructions. Just do as much as you can.

entry.question: Are you allowed to play Collateral Damage even if you do not have a weapon on the field? Or if there are no weapons on the field for either players and you just want the discard effect?
entry.answer: You can play Collateral Damage even if there are no weapons on the field or cards in your hands to scrap. Do as much as you can.
